questions.question: After a flood destroys crops, animals, and shelter, a family decides to replant. What is the benefit of farming this way

choices.answer: Farming leaves people open to attack, but needs less land than hunting
harvest not certain due to weather, but more people work and build shelter
Farming gives new sources of material for clothing
Nomads might steal food, but food surpluses allow workers to specialize

questions.question: What major change did people make during the Neolithic Agricultural Revolution?

choices.answer: They began hunting
They began farming
They began trading
They began gathering

questions.question: Where did the earliest humans live?

choices.answer: North America
Asia
Africa
Europe

questions.question: Who made up the largest social class of early civilizations?

choices.answer: Enslaved people
Farmers and skilled workers
Priests and rulers
Merchants and traders

questions.question: Both Homo Sapiens and Neanderthals hunted animals and used fire

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: What is the correct order of earliest development to latest development

choices.answer: Agriculture, Hunt & Gather, Cities Develop, Farming Villages
Hunt & Gather, Agriculture, Farming Villages, Cities Develop
Cities Develop, Farming Villages, Hunt & Gather, Agriculture
Farming Villages, Hunt & Gather, Cities Develop, Agriculture

questions.question: Why did the earliest civilizations appear in areas like Mesopotamia and the Indus Valley?

choices.answer: because these areas had the most domesticated animals
because these areas were isolated from other regions
because these areas were far away from oceans
because these areas were near rivers and fertile soil

questions.question: When archaeologists study an excavation site, objects found closer to the surface are

choices.answer: Often as damaged as those found below them
Unlikely to contain radioactive material
Impossible to date with any accuracy
Not as old as those found in deep layers

questions.question: How might the use of fire have affected human migration?

choices.answer: People could live in places that otherwise would have been too cold.
People could settle in one place where it was easy to keep a fire burning.
People could cook food and scare off dangerous animals.
People could be less dependent on daylight and travel at night.

questions.question: Looking at the table, Starting with earlier development which events will replace the ? marks on the table?

choices.answer: arrive in Asia; arrive in Australia and Pacific islands
arrive in Australia and Pacific islands; arrive in the Americas
arrive in Asia; arrive in the Americas
arrive in Australia and Pacific islands; arrive in Asia

questions.question: Why are archaeologists interested in the cave paintings found near Lascaux in southern France?

choices.answer: The paintings are the first evidence of early humans ever found in France.
The paintings provide evidence that humans had become more complex.
The caves did not exist during the last ice age.
The cave paintings are worth a great deal of money.

questions.question: Why is job specialization an important feature of civilization?

choices.answer: Job specialization creates social classes.
Job specialization allows the government to focus on the most urgent things
Job specialization allows for a variety of goods and services to be produce
Job specialization means that more people can practice religion.

questions.question: In what order did the rise of agriculture lead to a change in clothing

choices.answer: Farming plants , Domestication of Cotton, Weaving of Cotton
Domestication of Cotton, Farming plants, Weaving of Cotton
Weaving of Cotton, Farming of Cotton, Domestication of Cotton

questions.question: Writing was first developed in civilization as a way to keep what important records?

choices.answer: the names of gods and godesses
the number of people born
the amount of grain harvested
the lists of social classes

questions.question: Which of the following are NOT features of civilization

choices.answer: Social Classes
Art and Architecture
Cities
Transportation

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a way in which humans adapted to the environment during the last ice age

choices.answer: Migrate and follow animal herds for food
Migrate to warmer climates like Africa
Learned new ways to build shelter, and make warm clothing
Formed larger communities which allowed them to work together to hunt

questions.question: Did the domestication of animals lead to humans migrating, and not using animals for work, and food purposes?

choices.answer: True
False
